result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheryl R McMorris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cheryl R McMorris is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cheryl R McMorris was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Cheryl R McMorris was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Cheryl R McMorris was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED 9-15-2014:  Corrected to reflect credit for time served
Concurrent with: with Count 1

Defendant Cheryl R McMorris in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Cheryl R McMorris in custody.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Defendant enters oral DST.

BTC:  Instructions/verdicts to be filed before 5/16/14.  Motions to be filed before 4/25/14.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges:  Ct. 1 - 961.41(1m)(d)1, Possess w/Intent-Heroin; Ct. 2 - 961.41(3g)(c), Possession of Cocaine/Coca; Ct. 4 - 450.11(7)(h), Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription; Ct. 5 - 961.573(1), Possess Drug Paraphernailia.  Ct. 3 was previously dismissed. 
Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
